intro: Appendicula bracteata, commonly known as the bracted appendicula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its bracts, which are modified leaves, are prominent and often colorful, aiding in attracting pollinators. Appendicula bracteata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in rock gardens and alpine settings.
